newsitem.title: USA: Brown Group changes debt structure.
newsitem.headline: Brown Group changes debt structure.

text.p: Brown Group Inc said on Monday that it completed the repositioning of its debt, providing committed financing for long-term growth and investment in operations.
The repositioning includes the signing January 9 of a $155 million revolving credit facility.
Also included is the October 1996 sale of $100 million in 9-1/2 percent senior notes, due October 15, 2006.

"The new arrangements provide more balanced exposure to interest rates, enhanced financial flexibility and committed intermediate-term capital to support investment in our operations for long-term growth," chief financial officer Harry Rich said in a news release.
Shares of Brown Group, a footwear company, closed unchanged at 15-1/2 Monday.
